unnormalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Education has mandated that all Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) implement the Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) ID for students starting AY 2024-25. The ABC ID, a 12-digit unique identifier (e.g., 1234-5678-9012) is aimed at facilitating credit transfer and academic mobility across different institutions. The Univ Grants Commission (UGC) has urged institutions to integrate the ABC ID into their admission and examination processes.
normalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Education has mandated that all Higher Education Institutions (H-E-I-s) implement the Academic Bank of Credits (A-B-C) I-D for students starting A-Y two thousand twenty four to twenty five. The A-B-C I-D, a twelve-digit unique identifier (for example, one two three four dash five six seven eight dash nine zero one two) is aimed at facilitating credit transfer and academic mobility across different institutions. The University Grants Commission (U-G-C) has urged institutions to integrate the A-B-C I-D into their admission and examination processes.

unnormalised: Similarly, the Ministry of Labour & Employment is advocating for the universal adoption of the e-Shram card (e.g., 12345678901234567890) for all workers in the unorganized sector. This 20-digit identifier will enable better tracking of employment trends and facilitate access to social security benefits. Labour officials stated that registration drives will be conducted across various states to ensure maximum enrolment. The e-Shram portal has already registered over 28.5 cr workers.
